page.title: 18Braybrooke Church and Chapel
page.content: The two places of worship in Braybrooke are the Baptist Chapel and All Saints Church.On many occasions the two co- operate closely running joint activities such as Sunday School.As is the case in most communities the active members are a small minority of the population though services at Christmas and Harvest are well supported.The Church runs social activities such as Harvest Supper.The parish does not have a resident priest and is served by the vicar from Desborough.With a small congregation building maintenance is a constant problem.The earliest identifiable part of the church is the Norman font and it contains examples of all architectural styles used up to the 15th century.
